Reviews.Content: It's ok, but can be way better!!! WEll, I don't really know whether the hotel is to be rated ok or terrible! Staff there certainly was nice and I had the best coffee I've ever had there! But the rooms were terrible! Maybe the charm comes out in summer, but we were in Florence in the cold December days and it was aweful! The room had a weird smell and was very dark. The room was cold (although after we asked for it, we got an extra heater) and the bathroom small!I will definitely not come back here, although for the price you cant expect much in Florence...
Reviews.Author: TravelotNrw

Reviews.Content: Old World Charm in Florence We chose this hotel largely because it鈥檚 very near where our daughter is in school for the semester, at Syracuse University of Florence. If you鈥檙e looking for old world charm and won鈥檛 mind putting up with some of the inconveniences that come with such charm, this hotel is worth considering. The rooms are charming for sure, but they鈥檙e dimly lit, small, and the bathroom and shower are tiny. The room key is, well, a key, not a card, that you leave with the desk clerk when you leave, and retrieve on your return. It has the feeling of a European hotel in the 40s or early 50s. The staff is friendly and helpful. For the price we paid (under 70 Euros, off season), it鈥檚 a great deal!
Reviews.Author: garyLS

Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Il Granduca Wonderful stay.We really liked it here..The reception people were very nice and charming.Thank you for everything ( for the best capuccino and for helping out with our lost bags)
Reviews.Author: marko123london

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel and On street parking Booked here as I need to park my vehicle which can be a challenge in Florence. Bit of a walk into city but easily doable. Hotel was helpful we booked in early. We had room in wee apartment out the back (new) which was lovely. Some of the rooms we saw inside the hotel bit jaded. breakfast looked good but we missed the times. Would stay here again. Hotel provided parking disc which you pay for per 24hrs
Reviews.Author: 40degreesouth

Reviews.Content: Why I love Hotel Il Granduca I've stayed at Il Granduca 3 times now. That's the test of a good hotel.You keep going back. Il Granduca is a bed and breakfast hotel run with great attention to its customers by its owner. He is there every morning to see that breakfast is served to your satisfaction.There is a sunny court yard which even in November catches the wonderfully clear autumnal light. It's only a 15-20 minute walk into the Duomo and there are at least 4 buses you can take if you are feeling lazy. What I like above all is the sense that I am warmly welcomed and that the proprietor is proud of his establishment and its reputation for cleanliness, tasteful decor and abundant and varied breakfast fare.Staff at reception are courteous and ready to help you out at all times. I'm a retired high school teacher and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel very highly.
Reviews.Author: Vicky62

Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel       small quarters!
Reviews.Author: xxxlakerfan1

Reviews.Content: Very relaxing time at Hotel Il Granduca Had a wonderful time at the Hotel. The staff was very helpful and our stay was peaceful after four hectic days in Rome! The terrace was beautiful. I would definitely stay here again if I were to return to Florence.
Reviews.Author: sthinson

Reviews.Content: Highly Recommended Great amenities, staff, breakfast, and location. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff always made us feel welcome and were always helpful. We would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: 4_TravelersColorado

Reviews.Content: Great place to stay We stayed at this hotel in early April. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was excellent, providing a short walk to the major sites. Breakfasts were good, and the room was clean, but the bed was quite firm. We were able to park our car in one of the limited spaces, which was quite convenient.
Reviews.Author: Happy_Traveler033

Reviews.Content: Great hotel We just got back from a wonderful trip in Italy where we stayed at the Il Granduca while in Florence. The hotel was just what we wanted. It was quiet, clean, comfortable and the staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants and giving directions. Please be advised that the reason the hotel was quiet was because it was about a 15 min. walk to the Duomo and another 10 min. to the Ponte Vecchio. However, it was nice to be away from the tourists and like I said it was quiet at night. The breakfast they served was simple, but good. The room was not fancy, but a decent size. The bathroom was a bit small and the shower was tiny, but we managed just fine. All in all, we would stay there again the next time we go back to Florence.
Reviews.Author: NYDutch

Reviews.Content: never again When I read the hotel had a small garden where it was possible to eat breakfast I hoped it might compensate for my initial doubts after reading other reviews.Staff were very nice but my heart sank as I saw our 2nd floor room.Very high with too many shabby beds(3) - and a tiny bathroom cubicle inserted into the room. If the door was open it banged into the outer door. The wash basin was in the shower to save space!There was an overall impression was of greyness, the wallpaper was peeling, there were dangerously loose floor tiles, view abysmal over a busy street which was so noisy I had to sleep in ear plugs.My son's room ,although furnished better, faced a concrete wall and was so dark even in daylight that they kept the shutters closed and the light on.Breakfast was average although the nice guy on reception made really good coffee if asked.It was too much in the shade to eat in the garden though.
Reviews.Author: indigoheron

Reviews.Content: Don麓t know if I want to come again ... Situated in a residential area, 20 min. walk from the city center. Parking on the street in front of the hotel with a day-ticket for 8 EUR. Small, clean room - even smaller bed; nice breakfast (included). Nice staff, who mostly speaks at least some English.No luxury at all - but for 100 EUR per day relatively reasonable for Florence!
Reviews.Author: freqtravmuc

Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, noisy  The desk clerk at the Granduca was quite friendly and helpful, calling to reserve a cab to the airport for us for the a.m. of our departure, but we were very, very disappoitned with the room. We had booked three and a half months in advance of our trip using the hotel's website. Our room was clean but that was about the extent of the charm. We asked for the marital  full bed but got two very old, small and narrow (circa 1960) twin beds, with terribly worn out springs and thin mattresses. Instead of bath towels there were thin towels, hardly enough to cover half of a slim and not too tall person's back. The shower stall was so small one bumped elbows against it (and we are both slim and not very tall--I don't know what a six footer would do!) The ambience was very unsatisfactory--very, very noisy until 2 or 3 a.m. The hotel had evidently booked a large group of Italian high schoolers whose teachers did not control them and they carried on , yelling, slamming doors, all night. The desk clerk when we checked in had told us that the group had been imbibing and very noisy the previous night but that the kids' supervisors had promised to keep them in check from then on. No such luck. The night clerk was kind enough to make us espresso at 5 a.m. when we awaited our early cab to the airport. I wrote to report on our stay and received no response whatsoever. I say, for the money, if you want a 3 star hotel, skip this hotel and either go farther away from the Duomo or stay across the river.
Reviews.Author: ProfessoressaLV

Reviews.Content: Home away from home Il Granduca is a nice little hotel away from the crownes but still a walk distance to the downtown. The rooms a nice, clean and you can find all what you need. the best thing is to wake up in the mornig and enjoy the great breakfast where you will have a BIG cup of capucino, but remember ask the owner Sergio to make it , it's just wonderful.The people who works there are just so nice and helpfull, if you wan`t to rich a place just ask them , they will help you to get there in the best way. The litte garden or back yard is just so wonderfull, there you can sit down and read a book or plan the things to see in Florence or just write down the wonderfull things you have seen. Il Granduca is defenitly the best hotel I have ever stayed in Florence
Reviews.Author: snalla

Reviews.Content: Very nice and special place We had a business stay in florence and had a really great time. not only the great weather but also the really nice city was impressing.The Hotel il Granduca is a very nice, little place with an excellent service.The rooms are clean and neat.The breakfast was good and sufficient. Excellent coffee.All and one we had a pleasant stay and can recommend this place to all people who like to be in a special and homely place in a foreign city.
Reviews.Author: Uliw

Reviews.Content: loved this place ! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this small friendly hotel. Our room was spacious immaculately clean, on a quiet back street and just 10 min walk into the heart of Florence. The staff could not do enough for us, and took great pride in the hotel and our time spent there.Good breakfast and GREAT coffee. Would definately stay again
Reviews.Author: simon&clare

Reviews.Content: Loved Il Granduca I just came back from my trip to Italy. This is the third time that I've stayed at Hotel Il Granduca. I absolutely love it; the location, the place, the friendly atmosphere, and the willingness of the staff to always help you. The location is very convenient as it's located in a residential area within walking distance to the historic center of Florence, about 15 minutes from the Duomo. I am planning another trip next year,and I'll definetely stay at Il Granduca again.
Reviews.Author: RAMB

Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Il Granduca!       Ron in front of the Hotel
Reviews.Author: RichardDeLancey

Reviews.Content: Warm Hospitality Very friendly, English speaking hosts who create a cosy atmosphere in nice surroundings. Continental breakfast buffet with excellent huge cappuccino is the best I've ever had in Italy. The bathroom was very small, though, but the price for that location in such an expensive city a bargain.
Reviews.Author: eisenhans

Reviews.Content: Charming, friendly, hotel with great character. I was shocked to read the previous reviews after having such a fantastic 3 nights in this charming hotel. It's not the biggest hotel in the world but has great character, I for one get bored of large hotel chains which are the same the world over and have no identity with the country in which they are situated.This hotel is very typical of its surroundings, charming rooms with high ceilings and 'antique' furniture - whilst not the biggest room it totally fulfilled our requirements.The staff couldn't have been nicer, very friendly and helpful.The location was perfect - within easy walking distance of the main attractions yet far enough out to be quiet at night.I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family who want to really experience Florence and it's enchanting surroundings and feel part of the fantastic city rather than just be a mere visitor.
Reviews.Author: phils_abode

Reviews.Content: Would NEVER stay here again I was visting my boyfriend who was studying abroad, and when we arrived at the hotel the gentleman at the desk was very rude to both of us. I had booked a single room because my boyfriend's bedroom wasn't big enough for both of us. My boyfriend was there to help me with my bags, and the gentleman at the front desk told him he had to five minutes to help me and then he was to come downstairs. I had just traveled fourteen hours to see him, and I wanted to rest and be with my boyfriend. I couldn't because he only gave us five minutes before my boyfriend had to leave, and I wanted to be with him so I had to leave too. I was furious. When I got to the room it was about the size of a walkin closet, and had only a twin size bed, a dresser, a small TV at the foot of my bed, and enough room for my boyfriend and I to walk in single file. The shower was so small that when I tried to wash my hair the next morning my elbow hit the shower door, and knocked it open. I was so disgusted with the service and the way I was treated I checked out the next day even though I was supposed to stay for 8 nights, and ended staying at Hotel Dante which was lovely. I would not recommend this place to anyone traveling in Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Would Not stay here ever again We booked 3 nights at this hotel based on the previous reviews from other guests. Having read through the reviews again- I think we may have stayed in a totally different hotel.... On check in the hotel owner couldn't find our booking and was very unfriendly. He first gave us room #18 which was fine as it was a corner room and away from the noisy main street that the hotel in situated on. But to my alarment the bathroom toilet was broken as there was no toilet seat. We went downstairs twice to request for a change of room and the owner was very reluctant to give us a room change. Eventually he did but it was room #11 which was facing the main road and situated at the top of the stairs of the main stairwell of the hotel. The whole hotel is tiled therefore everything echoed and the walls moved when the main door to the hotel slammed and you could hear the staff talking loud in the hotel lobby throughout the night. The new room was not the best as the bathroom-although it now had a toilet seat, the shower was basically just a shower head located on the wall of the bathroom and a shower curtin, which was broken and had just been propped up across the bathroom door. Everything got wet including the toilet paper. The noise from the street was the worst and unbearable. We requested once again for a room change as we couldn't sleep and had 2 more nights in the hotel. The owner gave us hell saying that he had no spare room for us to move too, which I knew was crap as all the room keys were hanging behing the reception desk. We were not impressed wth his service and had to call the company that we booked the hotel through. We only managed to room move on our last night that we were there-once again a choice of another room on the street else it would be room #18- the one without the toilet seat . The owner also rudely insulted and embarrassed us infront of other guests that were staying there-which was VERY uncalled for.Unless we were just the unlucky ones to have stayed here- my advise to others considering to stay in this hotel- unless you are prepared to sqat on the toilet (hence no toilet seat), get zero sleep for 3 nights, be treated like absolute crap by the owner of the hotel and have your holiday ruined because of the lack of service of the hotel- I would recommend you pay a little bit more to get that extra bit of service or a little bit less to stay in a hostel of the same standard as this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Small but friendly The rooms are pretty small but that's fairly standard for a lot of budget European hotels. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. They even saved us breakfast one day after we'd missed the cut off time. I would definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: very cheap and yet charming we stayed 4 nights probably in the same room as the first writer, off the patio.The hotel has only some 20 rooms I saw a few others, all seemed nice. In june we were given a remote and adjusted our airconditioning, it took a while to cool the rather large room but than it was fine. The room was modern with antique touches, the staff very friendly and if late for breakfast all you needed was to ask for cheese or Cornets or whatever- great cappucino !For us, an elderly couple, walking to the duomo took a good 30 minutes... We opted for a taxi at 8 E. Or later bought the 24 hour hop on and off tour bus, which brought us very near the hotel. This distance was the only disadvantage, but as the cost of hotel was so low for Florence, it was fine.The hotel has a few parking spaces. These need to be reserved .The owners have a scheme for converting the place, moving breakfasts to the patio and much rebuilding, make sure this is not happening when you plan to stay there, at the moment it is one of the quietest spots in Florence.
Reviews.Author: Jerusalemite

Reviews.Content: Away from the crowds Spent three nights at this quiet little hotel, which was situated in a residential area of smart flats. The staff were friendly and welcoming and the quality of service was very good. We had a double room in a little annex in the courtyard which was of an excellent quality as it was newly finished. Breakfast was fairly standard buffet fare and you needed to get there early, in order to get best pick of the breakfast offeringsThe location is about 10 minutes walk from the Duomo. The benefit of this is that there are some some excellent Florentine restaurants nearby, which were recommended by the hotel. The concierge was happy to make a reservation for us, for the most popular restuarant. These places were popular with locals, served fantastic food and were good value.When we stayed in early May, the air conditioning was not switched on. At night, opening the windows brought traffic noise, from the busy Viale Giacomo Matteotti, and mosquitos. Keeping the windows shut at night was a good strategy. Note to Brits: a plug-in mosquito deterrent would probably be a good thing to bring with you on holiday.We walked from the station (SMN) which took about 20 minutes via the scenic route. If we did this again, we would probably take a taxi.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
